reporting-org.narrative: UK - Department for Business, Energy and Industrial Strategy

title.narrative: British Council - Vietnam - Newton Fund

description.narrative: The Newton Fund uses science and innovation partnerships to promote economic development and social welfare of partner countries.

The Newton Fund's primary objective is to reduce poverty by generating and putting into use knowledge and technology to address development challenges and advance development for the poorest people and countries. We will seek to maximise the practical impact of research and innovation to improve the lives and opportunities of the global poor. In achieving this we will grow the research and innovation capacity of developing countries, as well as contributing to the continued strength of the UK’s research and innovation system, and support our wider prosperity and global influence.

title.narrative: Science, Technology, Mathematics and Engineering (STEM) Education

description.narrative: Science, Technology, Mathematics and Engineering (STEM) policy dialogue and capacity building for teacher, public engagement through science communication and STEM resource development

To share UK experience in Science, Technology, Mathematics and Engineering (STEM) education at all levels (students, public and government) to support Vietnam in learning and aplying STEM approach at school level to help boost the country's aspiration of being developed as a knowledge based economy

reporting-org.narrative: UK - Department for Business, Energy and Industrial Strategy

title.narrative: Professional development - Science and Innovation Human Resource Training

description.narrative: Enhancing science and innovation capacity of Vietnam for sustainable development through training programme framework development and skill trainings for research managers/ researchers and research groups

Building capacity for Vietnam Science and Innovation (“S and I”) human resources: Supporting dialogue and knowledge exchange on S and I governance and strategic research policy development between Vietnam and the UK
Strand 1: PDE – 2019 –research skills training • Supporting researcher’s training skills based on the Research Development Framework i.e. project management, proposal and bid writing, communications, research impacts, IP ect.
Strand 2: PDE – 2019 - research management and governance skills training
Strand 3: PDE – 2019 - support research group collaboration VN - UK

reporting-org.narrative: UK - Department for Business, Energy and Industrial Strategy

title.narrative: Researcher Links - South East Asia Regional Call 2017

description.narrative: Joint workshops on priority research areas, with a focus on building capacity of early career researchers in South East Asian (SEA) region

To build sustainable reseacher links between the UK and 4 South East Asian countries (Vietnam, Thailand, Indonesia and the Phillipines) and build capacity for engagement in international research collaboration in areas that are relevant to economic development and social welfare at these countries. 2 workshops aiming at 20 researchers from the UK and 20 from 4 countries.
